PvSTATEM 0.0.2
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Simple example of basic PvSTATEM package pre-release version functionalities
    • Our datasets

    Read data stored in the csv file - output of examination

    read_data.Rd

    file structure based on the https://genome.med.harvard.edu/documents/luminex/IS2.3_SW_110_eng_us.pdf page 97 and Kenya screening csv files

    read_data(
  file_path,
  layout_file_path = NULL,
  check_plate = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE,
  colorize = !isTRUE(getOption("knitr.in.progress")),
  ...
)

    Arguments

    file_path

    path to the Luminex csv file

    layout_file_path

    path to the layout file

    check_plate

    if TRUE veryfies the plate - checks the consistency etc.

    verbose

    if TRUE, print out the progress of the function

    colorize

    if TRUE, colorize the output

    ...

    additional arguments passed down

    Examples

    plate_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "random.csv", package = "PvSTATEM")
plate <- read_data(plate_filepath, check_plate = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)



plate_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT_CO.csv", package = "PvSTATEM")
plate <- read_data(plate_filepath)
#> Reading MBA plate csv file...
#> 
#> 
#> Warning: incomplete final line found on '/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/PvSTATEM/extdata/CovidOISExPONTENT_CO.csv'
#> (WARNING)
#> The datatype Units contains NA values
#> (WARNING)
#> The datatype Analysis Types contains NA values
#> (NOTE)
#> CRC block found, omiting it for now
#> New plate object has been created with name:CovidOISExPONTENT_CO !
#> 
#> Running consistency checks...
#> (WARNING)
#> Plate contains at least one region that did not reach the specified bead count - 50
